job description:
• *OVERVIEW**
The Associate Research Scientist provides technical support for the formulation development of key cleaning product propositions that consistently meet or exceed consumer?s expectations while supporting business sustainability and meeting Seventh Generation authenticity and ingredient guidelines\. This involves a combination of skill in the laboratory, creative problem\-solving skills, an understanding of consumer drivers in our product categories, and the passion to bring truly differentiated products to market\.The associate research scientist will work across a wide portfolio of home and personal care products in the portfolio\.
  • *PRIMARY JOB DUTIES**
+ Support the downstream formulation team in their projects \(batching, formulating, running stability programmes\)
+ Formulate products that meet our performance and authenticity standards and ensure that products are delivered on\-time and within budget while meeting all consumer and technical objectives
+ Collaborate in product qualification including product stability testing, micro\-challenge, and performance testing\.
+ Collaborate on product development with manufacturers\.
+ Support scale up by generating data that provides a holistic picture of potential formula manufacturing behavior when applicable\.
+ Participate on needed basis in cross functional teams for new product development and launches\.
+ Conduct market analyses to identify products? innovative points of differentiation for formulation, claims and/or performance
+ Develop product specifications for new products and create documentation to support all product qualification requirements\.
+ Collaborate with R&D/Manufacturing partners to identify new technologies to improve product performance, authenticity and cost\.
+ Develop and maintain relationships with existing and potential raw material suppliers\.
+ Commit to personal development and professional growth by actively participating in personal development initiatives and applying developmental thinking within the context of planning and executing work\.
+ Perform other tasks as may be required by Research & Development in the fulfillment of its objectives
  • *KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS**
+ BS inChemistry or related discipline
+ 1\-2 years experience in R&D, Formula Development or Technical Product Management preferably in a consumer products goods company
+ Excellent laboratory working skills ? test designs, safety in working environment, report writing, experimental write up
+ Good analytical and interpretation skills and being able to communicate effectively
+ Good Project management skills
+ Computer skills, including Microsoft Office suite \(Word, Excel, Powerpoint\) and specification databased eg\. Product Vision\.
+ Strong organizational, verbal, and written skills with intense attention to detail\.
+ Strong problem solving and organizational skills and proven ability to work in a fast\-paced work environment\.
+ Able to prioritize and meet deadlines within specified time constraints\.
+ Capacity to flourish in an environment of rapid change and high ambiguity
+ Self\-motivated with an enhanced ability to work independently
+ Passion and strong alignment with Seventh Generation?s Mission, Vision and Values
+ Ability to operate effectively in a team
+ Willingness to continually embrace personal and professional development

# WORKING CONDITIONS

+ Lab and office environment
+ No specific physical requirements
+ Travel is expected up to max\. 10% of time
